FuncDef:
The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise default routes to its peer.
The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default configuration. The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise default routes to its peer. The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default configuration. By default, a device does not advertise any default route to its peer.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an IPv6 peer address.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal string in format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo: In an ORF scenario, if a device that does not support ORF exists on the network, you can configure the device to advertise ORF default routes to a peer group in the BGP-VPN-Target address family view to establish an ORF peer relationship.
